page.title: 13Hastings Hill and Grindon
page.content: The Bronze Age burial site of Hastings Hill overlooks the south western edge of Sunderland.It also forms the beginning of a green belt stretching two and a half kilometers towards Penshaw and Shiney Row. From the vantage point of Hastings Hill Bronze Age settlers could have surveyed forests of deciduous trees. Today looking north east and south east from the hill produces a totally different picture. Here lies the post- war building development of Sunderland a mixture of private and council built residential houses. One of the most important roads in the north east,the A19, borders this residential area. Both Grindon in the north and Middle Herrington in the south have easy access to the countyside and the town. They also have their own small local shopping areas and services.
